author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
Marathi author Shripal Sabnis on Saturday lodged a complaint with the Maharashtra police saying he received death threats for his remarks on Friday that Narendra Modi would forever be “smeared with the taint of the 2002 Gujarat riots” and was a Prime Minister he would not endorse.

The police said Dr. Sabnis received threats after his criticism of Mr. Modi at a function held at Pimpri-Chinchwad.

Dr. Sabnis said that while he attacked the Prime Minister and the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh in one context, he had commended Mr. Modi’s “courageous” trip to Pakistan and his invocation of Gautam Buddha and Mahatma Gandhi in his foreign diplomacy.

“When he [Mr. Modi] went to Pakistan to meet Nawaz Sharif, he could have been killed. Hafiz Saeed was there, Dawood Ibrahim was there. All the terrorist training centres are there, and someone’s bullet or bomb might have killed him,” Dr. Sabnis had said.

This ambivalent statement is being interpreted by Mr. Modi’s supporters as something that was in bad taste.

‘I praised him’

“I want to clarify that while I did condemn Mr. Modi for the 2002 riots, I was praising him for his courageous trip to Pakistan,” Dr. Sabnis said later.

The author said he would speak to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.

Police say

Shripal Sabnis was threatened after he criticised

Narendra Modi
title: Marathi author receives death threat, files complaint
